meanings.definition: Liquid that has percolated through a solid and leached out some of its constituents.
meanings.sent1: The leachate from the compost pile smelled unpleasant.
meanings.sent2: The landfill had a system to collect leachate to prevent contamination.
meanings.sent3: The leachate decided to take a detour through the soil instead of going straight down.
meanings.sent4: After the heavy rain, the streets were filled with leachate from the overflowing garbage bins.
meanings.sent5: The leachate trickled slowly, carrying away bits of the soil with it.

meanings.definition: To remove or extract soluble or other constituents from a substance by the action of a percolating liquid.
meanings.sent1: They used a special filter to leachate the minerals from the ore.
meanings.sent2: The rain will leachate the nutrients from the soil, making it less fertile.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to leachate the flavors from the herbs by steeping them in hot water.
meanings.sent4: The constant dripping of water will leachate the color from the fabric over time.
meanings.sent5: The acidic rain can leachate harmful chemicals from the old paint on the building.
